title: 5 boys forced to dip hands in hot oil to prove innocence | Indore News - Times of India

organizations.name: indore news - times of india indore

text:
INDORE: Five children sustained serious burns after their friend's father tricked them into dipping their hands in hot oil to prove their innocence in a case of stolen mobile phone in Ratlam district. 

The boys, aged between 8 years to 15 years, were made to take part in the 'truth test' by one Chhagan in Narsinghpada village under Raoti police station on Monday evening. 

Chhagan was attempting to make the boys confess for stealing a mobile phone belonging to his son Raju, 13. 

Chhagan initially thrashed Raju for losing the mobile phone. Later he suspected that he might have handed over the phone to his friends. 

Chaggan summoned Bablu, 15, Dashrath, 12, Sonu, 9, Hemraj, 13 and Sandeep, 8, and questioned them about the loss of mobile phone. 

Later, he tricked them into playing a game. He asked them to dip their hands in hot oil and assured them that only the one, who had stolen the mobile, will get hurt; others will remain unscathed. 

Trusting the man, the children dipped their hands in the hot oil. 

Bablu, Dashrath and Sonu sustained serious burns and were rushed to a hospital in Raoti for treatment. Hemraj and Sandeep were also treated for burns at the hospital. 

Reoti police station in-charge RS Rathore said he received a call around midnight that the children had been admitted in the hospital. 

"Their condition was not good. They are undergoing treatment," he said. 

Chaggan was arrested from neighbouring village by a team of police on Tuesday morning. A case was registered under relevant sections against him, Rathore said.
